critSpecial.Brawling: : The target must succeed at a Fortitude save against your class DC or be slowed 1 until the end of your next turn.
text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

meleeWeapons.name: Clan Dagger

critSpecial.Knife: : The target takes 1d6 persistent bleed damage. You gain an item bonus to this bleed damage equal to the weapon’s item bonus to attack rolls.
text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
This broad dagger is carried by dwarves as a weapon, tool, and designation of clan. Losing or having to surrender a clan dagger is considered a mark of embarrassment to most dwarves.

meleeWeapons.name: Club

critSpecial.Club: : You knock the target away from you up to 10 feet (you choose the distance). This is forced movement.
text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
This is a piece of stout wood shaped or repurposed to bludgeon an enemy. Clubs can be intricately carved pieces of martial art or as simple as a tree branch or piece of wood.

meleeWeapons.name: Dagger

critSpecial.Knife: : The target takes 1d6 persistent bleed damage. You gain an item bonus to this bleed damage equal to the weapon’s item bonus to attack rolls.
text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

meleeWeapons.name: Gauntlet

critSpecial.Brawling: : The target must succeed at a Fortitude save against your class DC or be slowed 1 until the end of your next turn.
text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

A pair of these metal gloves comes with full plate, half plate, and splint armor; they can also be purchased separately and worn with other types of armor. They not only protect your hands but also transform your hands into lethal weapons.

meleeWeapons.name: Katar

critSpecial.Knife: : The target takes 1d6 persistent bleed damage. You gain an item bonus to this bleed damage equal to the weapon’s item bonus to attack rolls.
text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
Also known as punching daggers, katars are characterized by their H-shaped hand grip that allows the blade to jut out from the knuckles.

meleeWeapons.name: Light Mace

critSpecial.Club: : You knock the target away from you up to 10 feet (you choose the distance). This is forced movement.
text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

A light mace has a short wooden or metal shaft ending with a dense metal head. Used much like a club, it delivers heavy bludgeoning blows, but with extra power derived from the head’s metal ridges or spikes.

meleeWeapons.name: Longspear

critSpecial.Spear: : The weapon pierces the target, weakening its attacks. The target is clumsy 1 until the start of your next turn.
text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

This very long spear, sometimes called a pike, is purely for thrusting rather than throwing. Used by many soldiers and city watch for crowd control and defense against charging enemies, it must be wielded with two hands.

meleeWeapons.name: Mace

critSpecial.Club: : You knock the target away from you up to 10 feet (you choose the distance). This is forced movement.

You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
With a stout haft and a heavy metal head, a mace is sturdy and allows its wielder to deliver powerful blows and dent armor.

critSpecial.Club: : You knock the target away from you up to 10 feet (you choose the distance). This is forced movement.
text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
This weapon has a short shaft ending in a metal ball studded with spikes.

critSpecial.Knife: : The target takes 1d6 persistent bleed damage. You gain an item bonus to this bleed damage equal to the weapon’s item bonus to attack rolls.
text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
Originally a farming tool used for reaping grain, this one-handed weapon has a short wooden handle ending in a curved blade, sometimes sharpened on both sides.

meleeWeapons.name: Spear

critSpecial.Spear: : The weapon pierces the target, weakening its attacks. The target is clumsy 1 until the start of your next turn.

This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
A long metal shaft ending with a metal spike, a spear can be used one-handed as a melee weapon and can be thrown.

critSpecial.Brawling: : The target must succeed at a Fortitude save against your class DC or be slowed 1 until the end of your next turn.

This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
Providing the same defensive function as a standard gauntlet, this version has a group of spikes protruding from the knuckles to deliver piercing damage with a punch.

meleeWeapons.name: Staff

This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
This long piece of wood can aid in walking and deliver a mighty blow.

meleeWeapons.name: Bastard Sword

text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
This broad-bladed sword, sometimes called the hand‑and‑a‑half sword, has a longer grip so it can be held in one hand or used with two hands to provide extra piercing or slashing power.

meleeWeapons.name: Battle Axe

critSpecial.Axe: : Choose one creature adjacent to the initial target and within reach. If its AC is lower than your attack roll result for the critical hit, you deal damage to that creature equal to the result of the weapon damage die you rolled (including extra dice for its potency rune, if any). This amount isn’t doubled, and no bonuses or other additional dice apply to this damage.

This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

These axes are designed explicitly as weapons, rather than tools. They typically weigh less, with a shaft reinforced with metal bands or bolts, and have a sharper blade, making them ideal for chopping limbs rather than wood.

This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
This strong but slender staff is tapered at the ends and well balanced. It’s designed to be an offensive and defensive weapon.

This short, curved, and crude makeshift blade often has holes drilled into it to reduce its weight. It’s a favored weapon of goblins.

You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
Essentially a longer version of the scimitar, this traditional elven weapon has a thinner blade than its cousin.

meleeWeapons.name: Falchion

critSpecial.Sword: : The target is made off-balance by your attack, becoming flat-footed until the start of your next turn.

You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
This weapon is a heavier, two-handed version of the curved-bladed scimitar. It is weighted toward the blade’s end, making it a powerful slashing weapon.

This halfling weapon looks like a long, two-pronged fork and is used as both a weapon and a cooking implement.

You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
This polearm consists of a long, single-edged blade on the end of a 7-foot pole. It is extremely effective at delivering lethal cuts at a distance.

meleeWeapons.name: Gnome Hooked Hammer

This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
This gnome tool and weapon features a hammer at one end and a curved pick on the other. It’s such a strange and awkward weapon that others think the gnomes are slightly erratic for using it.

meleeWeapons.name: Greataxe

This large battle axe is too heavy to wield with only one hand. Many greataxes incorporate two blades, and they are often “bearded,” having a hook at the bottom to increase the strength of their chopping power.

While many greatclubs are intricately carved, others are little more than a sturdy tree branch. These massive clubs are too heavy to wield with only one hand.

This pick has a longer handle and broader head than a regular pick. It is too heavy to wield in one hand.

This immense two-handed sword is nearly as tall as its wielder. Its lower blade is often somewhat dulled to allow it to be gripped for extra leverage in close-quarter fights.

This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

This polearm bears a long, often one‑sided, curved blade with a hook protruding from the blunt side of the blade, which can allow its wielder to trip opponents at a distance. Its shaft is usually 8 feet long.

This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. Similar to a sickle and used in some regions to reap grain, a kama has a short, slightly curved blade and a wooden handle.

A katana is a curved, single-edged sword known for its wickedly sharped blade.

A sap has a soft wrapping around a dense core, typically a leather sheath around a lead rod. Its head is wider than its grip to disperse the force of a blow, as the weapon’s purpose is to knock out its victim rather than to draw blood.

This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
Typically a round, convex, or conical piece of thick metal attached to the center of a shield, a shield boss increases the bludgeoning damage of a shield bash.

meleeWeapons.name: Shield Spikes

critSpecial.Shield: : You knock the target back from you 5 feet. This is forced movement.
text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
These metal spikes are strategically placed on the defensive side of the shield to deal piercing damage with a shield bash.

meleeWeapons.name: Shortsword

critSpecial.Sword: : The target is made off-balance by your attack, becoming flat-footed until the start of your next turn.
text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
These blades come in a variety of shapes and styles, but they are typically 2 feet long.

meleeWeapons.name: Spiked Chain

text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
This 4‑foot‑long length of chain is covered with barbs and has spikes on one or both ends. Some feature metal hoops used as handgrips.

meleeWeapons.name: Starknife

critSpecial.Knife: : The target takes 1d6 persistent bleed damage. You gain an item bonus to this bleed damage equal to the weapon’s item bonus to attack rolls.
text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

From a central metal ring, four tapering metal blades extend like points on a compass rose. When gripping a starknife from the center, the wielder can use it as a melee weapon. It can also be thrown short distances.

meleeWeapons.name: Temple Sword

critSpecial.Sword: : The target is made off-balance by your attack, becoming flat-footed until the start of your next turn.
text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

This heavy blade is favored by guardians of religious sites. It has a distinctive, crescent-shaped blade that seems to be a mix of a sickle and sword. It often has holes drilled into the blade or the pommel so that bells or other holy trinkets can be affixed to the weapon as an aid for prayer or mediation.

meleeWeapons.name: Trident

critSpecial.Spear: : The weapon pierces the target, weakening its attacks. The target is clumsy 1 until the start of your next turn.
text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
This three-pronged, spear-like weapon typically has a 4-foot shaft. Like a spear, it can be wielded with one hand or thrown.

meleeWeapons.name: War Flail

text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
This large flail has a long shaft connected to a shorter piece of stout wood or metal that’s sometimes inlaid with spikes.

meleeWeapons.name: Warhammer

text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
This weapon has a wooden shaft ending in a large, heavy metal head. The head of the hammer might be single-sided or double-sided, but it’s always capable of delivering powerful bludgeoning blows.

meleeWeapons.name: Whip

text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
This long strand of thick leather, often braided, delivers a painful but nonlethal slash at a distance, usually accompanied by a distinctive cracking sound.

meleeWeapons.name: Aklys

critSpecial.Club: : You knock the target away from you up to 10 feet (you choose the distance). This is forced movement.
text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

The aklys is a throwing club with a hook on one end and a lengthy cord attached to the other. Though aklyses aren’t available in most shops, one might be purchased for 5 gp from a vendor that specializes in strange weapons.

meleeWeapons.name: Aldori Dueling Sword

critSpecial.Sword: : The target is made off-balance by your attack, becoming flat-footed until the start of your next turn.
text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

An Aldori dueling sword is a slim, single-bladed dueling sword with a slight curve and
a sharp, reinforced point.

meleeWeapons.name: Dwarven War Axe

critSpecial.Axe: : Choose one creature adjacent to the initial target and within reach. If its AC is lower than your attack roll result for the critical hit, you deal damage to that creature equal to the result of the weapon damage die you rolled (including extra dice for its potency rune, if any). This amount isn’t doubled, and no bonuses or other additional dice apply to this damage.
text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
This favored weapon of the dwarves has a large, ornate head mounted on a thick handle. This powerful axe can be wielded with one hand or two.

meleeWeapons.name: Gnome Flickmace

text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

More a flail than a mace, this weapon has a short handle attached to a length of chain with a ball at the end. The ball is propelled to its reach with the flick of the wrist, the momentum of which brings the ball back to the wielder after the strike.

meleeWeapons.name: Ogre Hook

critSpecial.Pick: : The weapon viciously pierces the target, who takes 2 additional damage per weapon damage die.
text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
Ogres are known for using immense, curved picks called ogre hooks.

meleeWeapons.name: Orc Necksplitter

critSpecial.Axe: : Choose one creature adjacent to the initial target and within reach. If its AC is lower than your attack roll result for the critical hit, you deal damage to that creature equal to the result of the weapon damage die you rolled (including extra dice for its potency rune, if any). This amount isn’t doubled, and no bonuses or other additional dice apply to this damage.
text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
This single-bladed bearded axe has a jagged blade that’s perfect for separating bone from tendon and cartilage.

meleeWeapons.name: Sawtooth Saber

critSpecial.Sword: : The target is made off-balance by your attack, becoming flat-footed until the start of your next turn.
text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
The signature weapon of the Red Mantis assassins, this curved blade is serrated like a saw, hence the name.

rangeWeapons.name: Blowgun

critSpecial.Dart: : The target takes 1d6 persistent bleed damage. You gain an item bonus to this bleed damage equal to the weapon’s item bonus to attack rolls.
text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
This long, narrow tube is used for shooting blowgun darts, using only the power of a forcefully exhaled breath.

rangeWeapons.name: Crossbow

critSpecial.Bow: : If the target of the critical hit is adjacent to a surface, it gets stuck to that surface by the missile. The target is immobilized and must spend an Interact action to attempt a DC 10 Athletics check to pull the missile free; it can’t move from its space until it succeeds. The creature doesn’t become stuck if it is incorporeal, is liquid (like a water elemental or some oozes), or could otherwise escape without effort.
text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

This ranged weapon has a bow-like assembly mounted on a handled frame called a tiller. The tiller has a mechanism to lock the bowstring in place, attached to a trigger mechanism that releases the tension and launches a bolt.

rangeWeapons.name: Dart

critSpecial.Dart: : The target takes 1d6 persistent bleed damage. You gain an item bonus to this bleed damage equal to the weapon’s item bonus to attack rolls.
text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
This thrown weapon is larger than an arrow but shorter than a javelin. It typically has a short shaft of wood ending in a metal tip and is sometimes stabilized by feathers or fur.

rangeWeapons.name: Hand Crossbow

critSpecial.Bow: : If the target of the critical hit is adjacent to a surface, it gets stuck to that surface by the missile. The target is immobilized and must spend an Interact action to attempt a DC 10 Athletics check to pull the missile free; it can’t move from its space until it succeeds. The creature doesn’t become stuck if it is incorporeal, is liquid (like a water elemental or some oozes), or could otherwise escape without effort.
text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

Sometimes referred to as an alley bow by rogues or ruffians, this small crossbow fires small bolts that are sometimes used to deliver poison to the target. It’s small enough to be shot one-handed, but it still requires two hands to load.

rangeWeapons.name: Heavy Crossbow

critSpecial.Bow: : If the target of the critical hit is adjacent to a surface, it gets stuck to that surface by the missile. The target is immobilized and must spend an Interact action to attempt a DC 10 Athletics check to pull the missile free; it can’t move from its space until it succeeds. The creature doesn’t become stuck if it is incorporeal, is liquid (like a water elemental or some oozes), or could otherwise escape without effort.
text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
This large crossbow is harder to load and more substantial than a regular crossbow, but it packs a greater punch.

rangeWeapons.name: Javelin

critSpecial.Dart: : The target takes 1d6 persistent bleed damage. You gain an item bonus to this bleed damage equal to the weapon’s item bonus to attack rolls.
text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
This thin spear is well balanced for throwing but is not designed for melee use.

rangeWeapons.name: Sling

critSpecial.Sling: : The target must succeed at a Fortitude save against your class DC or be stunned 1.
text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
Little more than a leather cup attached to a pair of straps, a sling can be used to fling smooth stones or sling bullets at a range.

rangeWeapons.name: Alchemical Bomb

critSpecial.Bomb: : Increase the radius of the bomb’s splash damage (if any) to 10 feet.
text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
These bombs come in a variety of types and levels of power, but no matter the variety, you throw the bomb at the target and it explodes, unleashing its alchemical blast.

rangeWeapons.name: Composite Longbow

critSpecial.Bow: : If the target of the critical hit is adjacent to a surface, it gets stuck to that surface by the missile. The target is immobilized and must spend an Interact action to attempt a DC 10 Athletics check to pull the missile free; it can’t move from its space until it succeeds. The creature doesn’t become stuck if it is incorporeal, is liquid (like a water elemental or some oozes), or could otherwise escape without effort.
text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

This projectile weapon is made from horn, wood, and sinew laminated together to increase the power of its pull and the force of its projectile. Like all longbows, its great size also increases the bow’s range and power. You must use two hands to fire it, and it cannot be used while mounted. Any time an ability is specifically restricted to a longbow, such as Erastil’s favored weapon, it also applies to composite longbows unless otherwise stated.

rangeWeapons.name: Composite Shortbow

critSpecial.Bow: : If the target of the critical hit is adjacent to a surface, it gets stuck to that surface by the missile. The target is immobilized and must spend an Interact action to attempt a DC 10 Athletics check to pull the missile free; it can’t move from its space until it succeeds. The creature doesn’t become stuck if it is incorporeal, is liquid (like a water elemental or some oozes), or could otherwise escape without effort.
text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

This shortbow is made from horn, wood, and sinew laminated together to increase the power of its pull and the force of its projectile. Its compact size and power make it a favorite of mounted archers. Any time an ability is specifically restricted to a shortbow, it also applies to composite shortbows unless otherwise stated.

rangeWeapons.name: Halfling Sling Staff

critSpecial.Sling: : The target must succeed at a Fortitude save against your class DC or be stunned 1.
text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
This staff ends in a Y-shaped split that cradles a sling. The length of the staff provides excellent leverage when used two‑handed to fling rocks or bullets from the sling.

rangeWeapons.name: Longbow

critSpecial.Bow: : If the target of the critical hit is adjacent to a surface, it gets stuck to that surface by the missile. The target is immobilized and must spend an Interact action to attempt a DC 10 Athletics check to pull the missile free; it can’t move from its space until it succeeds. The creature doesn’t become stuck if it is incorporeal, is liquid (like a water elemental or some oozes), or could otherwise escape without effort.
text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

This 5-foot-tall bow, usually made of a single piece of elm, hickory, or yew, has a powerful draw and is excellent at propelling arrows with great force and at an extreme distance. You must use two hands to fire a longbow, and it can’t be used while mounted.

rangeWeapons.name: Shortbow

critSpecial.Bow: : If the target of the critical hit is adjacent to a surface, it gets stuck to that surface by the missile. The target is immobilized and must spend an Interact action to attempt a DC 10 Athletics check to pull the missile free; it can’t move from its space until it succeeds. The creature doesn’t become stuck if it is incorporeal, is liquid (like a water elemental or some oozes), or could otherwise escape without effort.
text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
This smaller bow is made of a single piece of wood and favored by skirmishers and cavalry.

rangeWeapons.name: Shuriken

critSpecial.Dart: : The target takes 1d6 persistent bleed damage. You gain an item bonus to this bleed damage equal to the weapon’s item bonus to attack rolls.
text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
This “throwing star” is a small piece of flat metal with sharp edges, designed to be flung with a flick of the wrist.

rangeWeapons.name: Arrows

critSpecial.Bow: : If the target of the critical hit is adjacent to a surface, it gets stuck to that surface by the missile. The target is immobilized and must spend an Interact action to attempt a DC 10 Athletics check to pull the missile free; it can’t move from its space until it succeeds. The creature doesn’t become stuck if it is incorporeal, is liquid (like a water elemental or some oozes), or could otherwise escape without effort.
text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

rangeWeapons.name: Blowgun Darts

critSpecial.Dart: : The target takes 1d6 persistent bleed damage. You gain an item bonus to this bleed damage equal to the weapon’s item bonus to attack rolls.
text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
These thin, light darts are typically made of hardwood and stabilized with fletching of down or fur. They are often hollow so they can be used to deliver poison.

rangeWeapons.name: Bolts

critSpecial.Bow: : If the target of the critical hit is adjacent to a surface, it gets stuck to that surface by the missile. The target is immobilized and must spend an Interact action to attempt a DC 10 Athletics check to pull the missile free; it can’t move from its space until it succeeds. The creature doesn’t become stuck if it is incorporeal, is liquid (like a water elemental or some oozes), or could otherwise escape without effort.
text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
Shorter than traditional arrows but similar in construction, bolts are the ammunition used by crossbows.

rangeWeapons.name: Sling Bullets

critSpecial.Sling: : The target must succeed at a Fortitude save against your class DC or be stunned 1.
text: Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make an attack with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.
These are small metal balls, typically either iron or lead, designed to be used as ammunition in slings.

baseMagicWeapons.name: Magic Weapon (+1)
text: A magic weapon is a weapon etched with only fundamental runes. A weapon potency rune gives an item bonus to attack rolls with the weapon, and a striking rune increases the weapon’s number of weapon damage dice.

The Prices here are for all types of weapons. You don’t need to adjust the Price from a club to a greataxe or the like. These weapons are made of standard materials, not precious materials such as cold iron.
This weapon has a
rune (+1 item bonus to attack rolls with the weapon).

baseMagicWeapons.name: Magic Weapon (+1 Striking)
text: A magic weapon is a weapon etched with only fundamental runes. A weapon potency rune gives an item bonus to attack rolls with the weapon, and a striking rune increases the weapon’s number of weapon damage dice.

The Prices here are for all types of weapons. You don’t need to adjust the Price from a club to a greataxe or the like. These weapons are made of standard materials, not precious materials such as cold iron.
This weapon has a
rune (+1 item bonus to attack rolls with the weapon) and a
rune (one extra damage die).

baseMagicWeapons.name: Magic Weapon (+2 Striking)
text: A magic weapon is a weapon etched with only fundamental runes. A weapon potency rune gives an item bonus to attack rolls with the weapon, and a striking rune increases the weapon’s number of weapon damage dice.

The Prices here are for all types of weapons. You don’t need to adjust the Price from a club to a greataxe or the like. These weapons are made of standard materials, not precious materials such as cold iron.
This weapon has a
rune (+2 item bonus to attack rolls with the weapon) and a striking rune (one additional damage die).

baseMagicWeapons.name: Magic Weapon (+2 Greater Striking)
text: A magic weapon is a weapon etched with only fundamental runes. A weapon potency rune gives an item bonus to attack rolls with the weapon, and a striking rune increases the weapon’s number of weapon damage dice.

The Prices here are for all types of weapons. You don’t need to adjust the Price from a club to a greataxe or the like. These weapons are made of standard materials, not precious materials such as cold iron.
This weapon has a
rune (+2 item bonus to attack rolls with the weapon) and a
rune (two extra damage dice).

baseMagicWeapons.name: Magic Weapon (+3 Greater Striking)
text: A magic weapon is a weapon etched with only fundamental runes. A weapon potency rune gives an item bonus to attack rolls with the weapon, and a striking rune increases the weapon’s number of weapon damage dice.

The Prices here are for all types of weapons. You don’t need to adjust the Price from a club to a greataxe or the like. These weapons are made of standard materials, not precious materials such as cold iron.
This weapon has a
rune (+3 item bonus to attack rolls with the weapon) and a
rune (two extra damage dice).

baseMagicWeapons.name: Magic Weapon (+3 Major Striking)
text: A magic weapon is a weapon etched with only fundamental runes. A weapon potency rune gives an item bonus to attack rolls with the weapon, and a striking rune increases the weapon’s number of weapon damage dice.

The Prices here are for all types of weapons. You don’t need to adjust the Price from a club to a greataxe or the like. These weapons are made of standard materials, not precious materials such as cold iron.
This weapon has a
rune (+3 item bonus to attack rolls with the weapon) and a
rune (three extra damage dice).

specialMaterialWeapons.name: Cold Iron Weapon (Low-Grade)
specialMaterialWeapons.Craft Requirements: at least 20 sp of cold iron + 2 sp per Bulk
text: Cold iron weapons deal additional damage to creatures with weakness to cold iron, like demons and fey.

specialMaterialWeapons.name: Cold Iron Weapon (Standard-Grade)
specialMaterialWeapons.Craft Requirements: at least 110 gp of cold iron + 11 gp per Bulk
text: Cold iron weapons deal additional damage to creatures with weakness to cold iron, like demons and fey.

specialMaterialWeapons.name: Cold Iron Weapon (High-Grade)
specialMaterialWeapons.Craft Requirements: at least 4,500 gp of cold iron + 450 gp per Bulk
text: Cold iron weapons deal additional damage to creatures with weakness to cold iron, like demons and fey.

specialMaterialWeapons.name: Silver Weapon (Low-Grade)
specialMaterialWeapons.Craft Requirements: at least 20 sp of silver + 2 sp per Bulk
text: Silver weapons deal additional damage to creatures with weakness to silver, like werewolves, and ignore the resistances of some other creatures, like devils.

specialMaterialWeapons.name: Silver Weapon (Standard-Grade)
specialMaterialWeapons.Craft Requirements: at least 110 gp of silver + 11 gp per Bulk
text: Silver weapons deal additional damage to creatures with weakness to silver, like werewolves, and ignore the resistances of some other creatures, like devils.

specialMaterialWeapons.name: Silver Weapon (High-Grade)
specialMaterialWeapons.Craft Requirements: at least 4,500 gp of silver + 450 gp per Bulk
text: Silver weapons deal additional damage to creatures with weakness to silver, like werewolves, and ignore the resistances of some other creatures, like devils.

specialMaterialWeapons.name: Adamantine Weapon (Standard-Grade)
specialMaterialWeapons.Craft Requirements: at least 175 gp of adamantine + 17.5 gp per Bulk
text: Adamantine weapons have a shiny black appearance and cut through lesser items with ease. They treat any object they hit as if it had half as much Hardness as usual, unless the object’s Hardness is greater than that of the adamantine weapon.

specialMaterialWeapons.name: Adamantine Weapon (High-Grade)
specialMaterialWeapons.Craft Requirements: at least 6,750 gp of adamantine + 675 gp per Bulk
text: Adamantine weapons have a shiny black appearance and cut through lesser items with ease. They treat any object they hit as if it had half as much Hardness as usual, unless the object’s Hardness is greater than that of the adamantine weapon.

specialMaterialWeapons.name: Darkwood Weapon (Standard-Grade)
specialMaterialWeapons.Craft Requirements: at least 175 gp of darkwood + 17.5 gp per Bulk
text: Darkwood weapons are as dark as ebony, with a slight purple tint. A darkwood weapon’s Bulk is reduced by 1 (or to light Bulk if its normal Bulk is 1, with no effect on a weapon that normally has light Bulk).

specialMaterialWeapons.name: Darkwood Weapon (High-Grade)
specialMaterialWeapons.Craft Requirements: at least 6,750 gp of darkwood + 675 gp per Bulk
text: Darkwood weapons are as dark as ebony, with a slight purple tint. A darkwood weapon’s Bulk is reduced by 1 (or to light Bulk if its normal Bulk is 1, with no effect on a weapon that normally has light Bulk).

specialMaterialWeapons.name: Mithral Weapon (Standard-Grade)
specialMaterialWeapons.Craft Requirements: at least 175 gp of mithral + 17.5 gp per Bulk
text: Mithral weapons are slightly lighter than silver. A mithral weapon is 1 Bulk lighter than normal (or light Bulk if its normal Bulk is 1, with no effect on a weapon that normally has light Bulk).

specialMaterialWeapons.name: Mithral Weapon (High-Grade)
specialMaterialWeapons.Craft Requirements: at least 6,750 gp of mithral + 675 gp per Bulk
text: Mithral weapons are slightly lighter than silver. A mithral weapon is 1 Bulk lighter than normal (or light Bulk if its normal Bulk is 1, with no effect on a weapon that normally has light Bulk).

specialMaterialWeapons.name: Orichalcum Weapon (High-Grade)
specialMaterialWeapons.Craft Requirements: at least 11,250 gp of orichalcum + 1,125 gp per Bulk
text: Orichalcum weapons can have four magic property runes instead of three. Due to orichalcum’s temporal properties, etching the

weapon property rune onto an orichalcum weapon costs half the normal Price (though transferring the rune to a weapon made of another material requires you to first pay the remaining Price and then pay the cost to transfer).

magicWeapons.name: Fighter's Fork
text: This
+1 trident
, usually engraved with a decorative pattern resembling fish scales, is a common weapon among warriors of aquatic ancestries.
magicWeapons.Effect: You extend or shorten the trident’s haft. When extended, the trident requires two hands to wield and gains the reach trait, but loses the trident’s normal thrown trait.

magicWeapons.name: Retribution Axe
text: The blade of this
+1 greataxe

bears a design of a human skull. Whenever a creature damages you with an attack, the skull changes its appearance to look like the face of that creature. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your next damage roll against that creature before the end of your next turn. Because the face reshapes each time you’re damaged, you get the additional damage only if you attack the creature that damaged you most recently.

magicWeapons.name: Dagger of Venom
text: The serrated blade of this
+1 striking dagger
has a greenish tinge, and the hilt is sculpted to look like the head of a serpent about to strike. When you critically succeed at an attack roll with the
dagger of venom
, the target becomes sickened 1 unless it succeeds at a DC 19 Fortitude save. This is a poison effect. In addition, you can activate the dagger to poison a creature with a more potent poison.
dagger of venom
magicWeapons.Effect: You poison the creature you hit with dagger venom.

magicWeapons.name: Caterwaul Sling
text: Made of shiny brown leather, this
+1 striking sling
has a single white thread interwoven into its cord.
magicWeapons.Effect: You pull the white thread free, then whirl the sling in circles at high speed. It lets out an ear-piercing wave of sound. Each creature in a 30-foot cone takes 4d6 sonic damage (DC 21 basic Fortitude save). Any creature that fails is deafened for 1 round, or 1 hour on a critical failure.

magicWeapons.name: Bloodletting Kukri
text: This
+1 striking kukri

has a crimson blade that shimmers eerily in bright light. On a critical hit, the kukri deals 1d8 persistent bleed damage. If the target didn’t already have persistent bleed damage when you scored the critical hit, you also gain 1d8 temporary Hit Points.

magicWeapons.name: Twining Staff
text: Appearing to be just a small, flat disc made of twigs, this item can grow and shrink.
+1 striking staff
+1 striking bo staff
magicWeapons.Effect: When you expand the item, you can use the force of the expansion to High Jump or to try to Force Open a door or the like by wedging the disc into a gap before activation. The staff makes the Athletics check with a +15 modifier.

magicWeapons.name: Eclipse
text: This charm, a dragon-shaped pendant worn like a necklace or set into armor or clothing as a decoration, is warm and smooth to the touch. It must be held in one hand to be used (pressing the palm of one’s hand to the charm also works, provided that your hand is otherwise empty). It has four distinct powers.
dragon’s eye charm
spell with a spell attack roll of +13.
for as long as you Sustain the Activation, to a maximum of 10 minutes.
dragon’s eye charm
as long as you Sustain the Activation, to a maximum of 10 minutes.

magicWeapons.name: Gloom Blade
text: As black as coal, this blade grows more potent in darkness. While in bright light, it functions as a
+1 shortsword
and doesn’t appear to radiate a magic aura to detect magic or similar spells unless the spells are 4th level or higher.
In dim light or darkness, the gloom blade becomes a
+2 striking shortsword
. Whenever you use the
gloom blade
to attack a creature you’re undetected by, you deal 1d6 additional precision damage.
To upgrade the
gloom blade’s
fundamental runes, start with the base
+1 shortsword
, but if you improve it beyond a
+2 striking shortsword
, the runes apply in dim light or darkness as well.

magicWeapons.name: Oathbow
text: Constructed of a flexible, white wood and with ornate, twisting designs carved into its surface, this
+2 striking composite longbow
appears to have been made by elves. Sometimes when you loose an arrow, its whistling in flight sounds like a voice whispering in Elven, wishing for the swift defeat of your enemies.
magicWeapons.Effect: After you activate the bow, you can’t activate it again for 7 days. If you kill the creature you’ve sworn an oath against, the oath ends and you need to wait only 10 minutes before you can activate it again.

magicWeapons.name: Dwarven Thrower
text: This
+2 striking warhammer
is inlaid with precious metals and decorated with geometric patterns in a dwarven style. If you’re a dwarf, a
dwarven thrower
functions for you as a
+2 greater striking returning warhammer
with the thrown 30 feet trait, and your attacks with the hammer deal 1d8 additional damage against giants.

magicWeapons.name: Flame Tongue
text: This
has an ornate brass hilt and a blade shaped like stylized flames. When wielded, the blade projects illumination resembling shimmering firelight, emitting dim light in a 10-foot radius.
cantrip from the sword as a 7th-level arcane spell, using your melee attack modifier with
as your spell attack modifier.

magicWeapons.name: Holy Avenger
text: The gleaming
holy avenger
is the iconic weapon of powerful
. The crossbar of this
+2 greater striking holy cold iron longsword
is styled to look like angel wings. Tradition holds that those who see their reflection in a
holy avenger’s
highly polished blade have their faults laid bare. If you are evil, you are enfeebled 2 while carrying or wielding this weapon.

magicWeapons.name: Frost Brand
text: The blade of this
+2 greater striking greater frost greatsword
appears to be nothing but icy shards. The
frost brand
automatically extinguishes non-magical fires in a 20-foot emanation. While wielding it, you gain fire resistance 5.
frost brand
magicWeapons.Effect: into the area of an ongoing magical fire, and the blade attempts to counteract the fire with a counteract modifier of +27. If it fails, it can’t attempt to counteract the same fire again.

magicWeapons.name: Sky Hammer
text: The sturdy, steel head of this
+3 major striking flaming shock orichalcum warhammer
is shaped like a blazing comet.
sky hammer
spell explodes, centered on the sky hammer. The spell DC is 45. You are immune to the
fireball’s
effect, though your allies are not.
